intro: Macleania antioquiae, commonly known as the Antioquian heather, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andes mountains in Colombia, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shaded, rocky or forested areas, preferring well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
